overview: 2 John is a brief letter warning against showing hospitality to false teachers who deny Christ came in the flesh. Truth and love must go together—love doesn't mean accepting every teaching.

verses.text: And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.
Everyone who goes on ahead and does not abide in the teaching of Christ, does not have God. Whoever abides in the teaching has both the Father and the Son.

passages.title: Truth and Love
passages.summary: John writes to the 'elect lady' (possibly a church) about walking in truth and love together—they belong together.

facts.text: 2 John is the shortest book in the Bible by word count in the original Greek.
The 'elect lady' may be a church personified as a woman, or an actual woman hosting a house church.
John warns against giving traveling teachers hospitality if they deny Christ—supporting them means sharing in their evil.

figures.name: John
figures.description: The elder writing to protect his spiritual children from deception while encouraging love and obedience.

videos.title: 1-3 John Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores John's three letters together.
